translated: The mantra there is: O, I am of the nature of the vajra of affection of all tathāgatas. This is the consecration of Ratnasaṃbhava.

analyzed: tatas hūkāra gītam udāharan yoṣit karma sthaḥ bhavet
translated: Then, uttering the song of the syllable hūṃ, one should remain in the act of a woman.

analyzed: kṣaraṇa avasthāyāḥ phaṭkāra mantram uccārayet
translated: At the time of emission, one should utter the mantra of the syllable phaṭ.

original: tataḥ kāyamāṇḍaleyadevatāḥ para mānandasukhamanubhūya nāḍīvivarādbindurūpeṇa padmamadhye nipatanti /
analyzed: tatas kāyamāṇḍaleya devatāḥ para ma ānanda sukham anubhūya nāḍī vivarāt bindu rūpeṇa padma madhye nipatanti
translated: Then, the deities of the body maṇḍala, having experienced the bliss of supreme joy, fall in the form of a drop in the middle of the lotus through the opening of the channel.

analyzed: asya sūtra prathama paṭale sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta hṛdaya vajra yoṣit bhageṣu vijahāra iti
translated: In the first chapter of this sūtra, it is said: He dwelt in the bhaga of the vajra woman, the heart of the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

analyzed: eva bodhi citta avasthāyām amogha siddhi adhiṣṭhānam adhimucya ṣaṣṭha pa ṭala ukta pūjā mantreṇa advaya ahaṅkāra kuryāt
translated: Thus, in the state of bodhicitta, having imagined the consecration of Amoghasiddhi, one should generate non-dual pride with the mantra of worship stated in the sixth chapter.

analyzed: tatra ayam mantraḥ sarva tathāgata pūjā vajra svabhāva ātmakaḥ ham iti
translated: The mantra there is: O, I am of the nature of the vajra of worship of all tathāgatas.

original: eva pañcatathāgatānupraveśenātmānamadhiṣṭhāya samādhyabhiṣekapūjā paryanta sarvakulātmakāhaṅkāra kṛtvā parārthasampattaye bhavotpattikrameṇa
analyzed: eva pañca tathāgata anupraveśena ātmānam adhiṣṭhāya samādhi abhiṣeka pūjā sarva kula ātmaka ahaṅkāra kṛtvā parārtha sampattaye bhava utpatti krameṇa
translated: Thus, having empowered oneself by entering the five Tathagatas, having performed the worship of the consecration of samadhi, having made the pride of being the essence of all families, for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of others, in the order of the arising of existence,

analyzed: maṇḍala cakram utsṛjet
translated: In this way, having consecrated oneself with the entry into the five Tathagatas, having performed the worship of the consecration of samadhi up to the end, having made the ego which is the essence of all families, one should emit the circle of the mandala for the accomplishment of the welfare of others, in the order of the arising of existence.

analyzed: tatra akṣobhya samādhinā sattvānā dveṣa kleśa viśuddhi karoti
translated: There, by the samadhi of Akshobhya, one purifies the defilement of hatred in beings.

analyzed: eva vairocana samādhinā moha viśuddhim  ratna sambhava samādhinā māna viśuddhim
translated: In the same way, by the samadhi of Vairochana, one purifies delusion.🔽By the samadhi of Ratnasambhava, one purifies pride.

analyzed: amita ābha samādhinā
translated: By the samadhi of Amitabha, one purifies passion.

analyzed: amogha siddhi samādhinā īrṣyā viśuddhim
translated: By the samadhi of Amoghasiddhi, one purifies envy.

original: sa eva bhagavānlo canāsamādhinā sattvānā śānti karoti /
analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavān lo canā samādhinā sattvānā śānti karoti
translated: That very Blessed One, by the samadhi of Lochana, brings peace to beings.

analyzed: māmakī samādhinā puṣṭim
translated: By the samadhi of Mamaki, one brings prosperity.

analyzed: pāṇḍara vāsinī samādhinā rakṣām
translated: By the samadhi of Pandaravasini, one brings protection.

analyzed: tārāsamādhinā karoti
translated: By the samadhi of Tara, one brings subjugation.

original: sa eva bhagavāntrūpavajrādikā bhūtvā sattvānā sukhasaumanasya māpādayati /
analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavān trūpa vajra ādikāḥ bhūtvā sattvānā sukha saumanasya m āpādayati
translated: That very Blessed One, having become Rupavajra and so forth, brings about happiness and joy to beings.

analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavān kṣitigarbha ādi bodhisattva samādhibhiḥ sattvānām āyatana viśuddhi karoti
translated: That very Blessed One, by the samadhis of the Bodhisattvas Kshitigarbha and so forth, brings about the purification of the sense bases for beings.

analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavān yama antaka ādi krodha samādhibhiḥ daśa diś vighna gaṇāḥ tarjayati
translated: He alone, the Blessed One, with the concentrations of wrathful deities such as Yamântaka, threatens the hosts of obstacles in the ten directions.

analyzed: sarva yogaḥ hi bhagavān vajra sattvaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Blessed One, Vajrasattva, the Tathâgata, is indeed all yoga.

analyzed: tasya upabhoga vai traidhātukam aśeṣatas
translated: All of this is his enjoyment, the entire three realms without exception.

analyzed: iti vacanāt
translated: Thus it is said.

original: maṇḍalarājāgrī nāma dvitīyaḥ samādhiḥ //🔽eva dvātriśaddevatācakramabhinirmāya sūkṣmayoga bāhyādhyātmikajāpa
analyzed: maṇḍala rājāgrī nāma dvitīyaḥ samādhiḥ  eva dvātriśat devatā cakram abhinirmāya sūkṣma yoga bāhya ādhyātmika jāpa
translated: The second concentration is called the king of mandalas.

analyzed: ca kṛtvā punar ātmānam eva tathatāyā praveśayet
translated: Having thus created the wheel of thirty-two deities, having performed the external and internal recitation with subtle yoga, he should again introduce himself into suchness.

original: tato locanādica turdevyo maṇḍalamadhye mahāsukhamapaśyantyo virahakhedavaśāt tva vajra cittetyādigītikābhirmahāsukha prabodhayanti /🔽tatreya gītikā tva vajracitta bhuvaneśvara sattvadhāto trāyāhi mā ratimanojña mahārthakāmaiḥ /
analyzed: tatas devyaḥ maṇḍala madhye mahā sukham a paśyantyaḥ viraha kheda vaśāt tva vajra citta ityādi gītikābhiḥ mahā sukha prabodhayanti  tva vajra citta bhuvana īśvara sattvadhāto trāyāhi mā rati manojña mahā artha kāmaiḥ
translated: Then the four goddesses beginning with Locanâ, not seeing great bliss in the center of the mandala, out of the anguish of separation, awaken great bliss with songs such as O Vajra Mind and so on.🔽There this is the song: O Vajra Mind, Lord of the World, Essence of Beings, save me! With the most delightful desires for great bliss,

original: kāmāhi mā janaka sattvamahāgrabandho yadīcchase jīvitu mhya nātha //
analyzed: mā janaka sattva mahā agra bandho yadi icchase nātha
translated: Love me, O Father, Bond of the Great Being! If you wish to live, O Lord!

original: tva vajrakāya bahusattvapriyāṅkacakra buddhārtha bodhiparamārtha hitānudarśī /
analyzed: tva vajra kāya bahu sattva priya aṅka cakra buddha artha bodhi parama artha hita anudarśī
translated: You whose body is vajra, dear to many beings, wheel of the body, you who see the highest truth of the Buddha's enlightenment and benefit,

original: rāgeṇa rāgasamayā mama kāmayasva yadīcchase jīvitu mahya nātha //
analyzed: rāgeṇa rāga samayāḥ mama kāmayasva yadi icchase nātha
translated: With passion, in accord with passion, love me, O Lord, if you wish to live for me.

original: tva vajravāca sakalasya hitānukampī lokārthakāryakaraṇe sada sampravṛtta /
analyzed: tva vajra vāca sakalasya hita anukampī loka artha kārya karaṇe sada sampravṛtta
translated: You vajra speech, compassionate to all, always engaged in the performance of actions for the benefit of the world,

original: kāmāhi mā suratacarya samantabhadra yadīcchase jīvitu mahya nātha //
analyzed: mā surata carya samanta bhadra yadi icchase jīvitu
translated: Love me, O Samantabhadra, in the practice of love, if you wish to live for me, O Lord.

original: tva vajrakāma samayāgra mahāhitārtha sambuddhavaśatilakaḥ samatānukampī /
analyzed: tva vajra kāma samaya agra mahā hita artha sambuddha vaśa tilakaḥ samatā anukampī
translated: You vajra desire, foremost in the pledge, of great beneficial purpose, crest jewel of the power of the perfect Buddhas, compassionate to all,

original: kāmāhi mā guṇanidhi bahuratnabhūtā yadīcchase jīvitu mahya nātha //
analyzed: mā bahu ratna bhūtā yadi icchase nātha
translated: Love me, O treasure of virtues, source of many jewels, if you wish to live for me, O Lord.

original: eva sadbhūtaguṇena sañcodite sati pūrvapraṇidhānasāmarthyādvyutthitasya tathāgatāścākṣobhyetyādistotrarājaiḥ stuvanti /
analyzed: eva sat bhūta guṇena sañcodite sati pūrva praṇidhāna sāmarthyāt vyutthitasya tathāgatāḥ ca akṣobhya ityādi stotrarājaiḥ stuvanti
translated: When thus exhorted by the true qualities, by the power of his former vows, when he has arisen, the Tathagatas praise him with the Stotra-raja, beginning with Akshobhya.

original: tatreya stutiḥ akṣobhyavajra mahājñāna vajradhātu mahābudha /
analyzed: tatra iyam stutiḥ akṣobhya vajra mahā jñāna vajra dhātu mahā budha
translated: There, this is the praise: Akshobhya-vajra, great wisdom, vajra element, great intellect,

original: trimaṇḍala trivajrāgra bhāṣa guhya namo'stu te //
analyzed: tri maṇḍala tri vajra agra bhāṣa guhya namaḥ astu te
translated: Three circles, foremost in the three vajras, speak the secret, homage to you!

analyzed: vairocana mahā śuddha vajra śānta mahā rate
translated: Vairocana, great purity, vajra peace, great joy,

analyzed: prakṛti prabhāsvarān dharmān deśa vajra namaḥ astu te
translated: To the naturally luminous dharmas, Vajra Speech, homage to you!

analyzed: ratnarāja kha vajra ākāśa nirmala
translated: Jewel King, with profound clarity, pure like the sky-vajra,

original: svabhāvaśuddha nirlopa bhāṣa guhya namo'stu te //
analyzed: svabhāva śuddha nirlopa bhāṣa guhya namaḥ astu te
translated: Pure by nature, without loss, Vajra Secret, homage to you!

analyzed: vajra amita mahā rāja nirvikalpa kha vajra dhṛk
translated: Vajra King of Immeasurable Greatness, holding the sky-vajra without conceptualization,

analyzed: rāga pāramitā prāpta bhāṣa vajra namaḥ astu te
translated: Attained the perfection of passion, Vajra Speech, homage to you!

analyzed: amogha vajra sambuddha sarva āśā paripūraka
translated: Vajra of Unfailing Success, Fully Enlightened One, Fulfiller of All Wishes,

analyzed: śuddha svabhāva sambhūta vajra sattva namaḥ astu te
translated: Arisen from the Pure Nature, Vajra Being, homage to you!

original: tadanantara buddhajñāna prakāśya maṇḍalacakramanurāgya pūrvavatsvakā yamaṇḍale praveśyopasahāra kuryādanena krameṇa /
analyzed: tad anantara buddha jñāna prakāśya maṇḍala cakram anurāgya pūrvavat sva kāya maṇḍale praveśya upasahāra kuryāt anena krameṇa
translated: After that, having illuminated the Buddha's wisdom, having honored the mandala wheel as before, one should enter one's own mandala and perform the offering with this sequence.

original: svahṛdayastha hūkāramu ccārya tena sakalasattvadhātūnmahāvajradhararūpapariṇatānvicintya tanmana sikāreṇa viharediti /
analyzed: sva hṛdaya stha hūkāram u ccārya tena sakala sattvadhātūn mahā vajradhara rūpa pariṇatān vicintya tad mana sikāreṇa viharet iti
translated: Having uttered the syllable HŪṀ located in one's heart, having contemplated all the realms of beings transformed into the form of the Great Vajra Holder, one should abide with that mental transformation.

analyzed: asya sūtra daśama paṭale bhāvayet vyūha maṇḍalam
translated: In this sūtra, in the tenth chapter, it is said: In the middle of the space element, one should contemplate the mandala array.

analyzed: hūkāra tatra madhya stha sva bimbena prakalpayet
translated: In the middle of that, with the syllable HŪṀ, one should imagine one's own form.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: evamādikarmikeṇa pratiṣṭhāpitasamayasavareṇābhiṣekaprāptena prākṛtā haṅkārāpagatena catuḥsandhyādevatāyogābhyāsena svaparārthasampādano tsukena śāntikarmādiviśiṣṭataramapi kartavyam /
analyzed: evamādi karmikeṇa pratiṣṭhāpita samaya savareṇa abhiṣeka prāptena prākṛtāḥ haṅkāra apagatena catur sandhyā devatā yoga abhyāsena sva para artha sampādana u tsukena śānti karma ādi viśiṣṭataram api kartavyam
translated: Thus, by one who is a beginner, who has established the sacred pledge, who has attained consecration, who has removed ordinary conceit, who practices the yoga of the deities of the four junctions, who is intent on accomplishing the welfare of self and others, even more excellent pacifying rites and so forth should be performed.

original: sādhanoktakrameṇā hāraśodhana kaṇṭhaśodhana hṛdayaśodhana ca kṛtvāhārakṛtya kuryāt sukhena pariṇamati /
analyzed: sādhana ukta krameṇa hāra śodhana kaṇṭha śodhana hṛdaya śodhana ca kṛtvā āhāra kṛtya kuryāt sukhena pariṇamati
translated: Having purified the throat and heart according to the method stated in the sadhana, one should perform the duties of eating, which will be easily digested.

original: bāhyādhyātmikahomena tryakṣareṇa mālāmantreṇa vā mantrauṣadhiyogenenāpi padmavajrasamāyogena ca sarvakarma prasādhayet /
analyzed: bāhya ādhyātmika homena tri akṣareṇa mālāmantreṇa vā padma vajra samāyogena ca sarva karma prasādhayet
translated: By the external and internal homa, by the three-syllabled mantra or the garland mantra, or even by the combination of mantra and medicine, and by the union of lotus and vajra, one should accomplish all activities.

analyzed: iti karmarājāgrī nāma tṛtīyaḥ samādhiḥ
translated: Thus ends the third samadhi called Karma-raja-agri.

analyzed: śrī guhya samāja mahā yogatantre bhava utpatti krameṇa vajra sattva niṣpādana sūtra samāptam
translated: In the Shri Guhyasamaja Mahayoga Tantra, the sutra on accomplishing Vajrasattva through the sequence of the origin of existence is complete.

analyzed: kṛtiḥ iyam ācārya candrakīrti pādānām
translated: This is the work of Acharya Chandrakirti's feet.
